data.question: What is the chemical formula of the spin-crossover coordination framework material synthesized using the ligand bpbd?
data.answer: [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone}

data.question: What external stimuli can modify the host-guest chemistry within the spin-crossover materials?
data.answer: Temperature, pressure, irradiation

data.question: How does the presence of guest molecules affect the spin-crossover transition in the previously reported nanoporous phase [Fe-(NCS)2(azpy)2]·1=2 {guest}?
data.answer: The spin-crossover transition is sensitive to the presence of included guest molecules.

data.question: What is the role of hydrogen-bonding interactions in the new spin-crossover material [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone}?
data.answer: Hydrogen-bonding interactions enhance host framework stability and influence both the temperature and nature of spin transitions.

data.question: What structural feature distinguishes the spin-crossover framework [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone} from isotopological frameworks with azpy and tvp bridges?
data.answer: The presence of hydrogen bonding interactions between the diol groups of the bpbd ligands and the sulfur atoms of thiocyanate groups.

data.question: What is the effect of desorption of guest acetone molecules on the framework structure of [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone}?
data.answer: Desorption leads to the formation of the apohost A with a single-crystal-to-single-crystal structural transformation, where the framework host structure is essentially unaltered.

data.question: What is the significance of the dihedral angle change in the pyridyl groups through the iron(II) center from 66.3 to 64.18?
data.answer: The change in the dihedral angle indicates pronounced structural stability to desolvation, attributed to the extensive interframework hydrogen-bonding network.

data.question: How does the spin-crossover transition in [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone} compare to isotopological frameworks with azpy and tvp bridges?
data.answer: The transition in [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone} is more abrupt, attributed to enhanced cooperativity between the iron(II) centers conferred by the network of interframework hydrogen-bonding interactions.

data.question: What does the decrease in the pore dimensions from 14.5 ; 14.5 to 14.2 ; 14.2 =2 indicate about the spin-crossover transition?
data.answer: It indicates a contraction in the framework associated with the transition from high-spin to low-spin states.

data.question: Why does the spin-crossover behavior remain remarkably similar after guest desorption in the framework A?
data.answer: The similarity in spin-crossover behavior is due to the absence of short host-guest interactions in A·{ac} and the presence of interframework hydrogen-bonding interactions, which impart robustness to the host lattice.

data.question: How does the slight decrease in transition temperature from T1=2 = 162 K in A·{ac} to 156 K in A affect the spin-crossover properties?
data.answer: The slight decrease in transition temperature suggests a small perturbation of the ligand-field splitting at the iron(II) center, likely due to subtle steric and electronic influences of the guest.

data.question: What role do the diol functional groups on the ligand play in the spin-crossover behavior of the framework?
data.answer: The diol functional groups provide structural stability and inflexibility to the host lattice, favoring a relatively abrupt spin-crossover transition.

data.question: Is the spin-crossover transition in [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone} sensitive to the presence of included guest molecules?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the guest acetone participate in short hydrogen-bonding interactions with the diol groups from the bpbd ligands?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the structural stability to desolvation in [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone} attributed to the absence of interframework hydrogen-bonding network?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does the transition temperature of the spin-crossover behavior increase with the removal of guest molecules?
data.answer: False

data.question: Are the interframework hydrogen-bonding interactions lost upon guest desorption in the framework A?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the spin-crossover transition in [Fe(NCS)2(bpbd)2]·{acetone} less abrupt compared to isotopological frameworks with azpy and tvp bridges?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does the presence of guest molecules have a major influence on the coordination environment of the iron(II) crossover centers?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the solvent-accessible void volume increased from 27.3 to 25.1% of the crystal volume after the spin-crossover transition?
data.answer: False
